ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Ssé ńne ńzíʼi pʉ̀a mmó ńdɔgɔ ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwó láʼ, metándá panuŋepwɔʼ pâ pakyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê lâ melÿò tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ tó.
en: One   day as he was teaching  # 20:1 Lk 19:47 the people in the temple and proclaiming the good news,  # 20:1 Lk 4:18; 8:1 the chief priests and the scribes, with the elders,  # 20:1 Lk 9:22; 22:66 came

ngiemboon: Ńzɛ́te yé ngie: «Shwóŋo wég, ɔ̀ lɔgɔ lezíŋ wɔ́ ńgÿo mɔɔn menò? Kwàʼ wɔ̌ zɔ tumó gú ngie ɔ̀ gÿo púʼu?»
en: and said to him, “Tell us, by what authority are you doing these things? Who is it who gave you this authority? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, n ge zɛ́te gẅí tàʼa nò. Pi shwóŋo wɔ́ɔn:
en: He answered them, “I will also ask you a question. Tell me,

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌ la túmo Jÿâŋ lénuʼ pʉ̀a ntse? E Ssé kà pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ?»
en: was the baptism of John from heaven or of human origin? ”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ júʼ, ńkwaŋte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: «Pege lɔɔn ńtsɔ́ʼ ngie: “E Ssé zɔ la túmo yé,” mbà à ge zɛ́te wégè ngie tà mélàʼakɔ́ pege la te zẅíŋe nò gie Jÿâŋ lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn wɔ́ wɔ́ɔ?
en: They discussed it among themselves: “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why didn’t you believe him? ’

ngiemboon: Ḿbiŋ ngie “pʉ̀a mesoŋ zɔ̌ la túmo yé,” mbà láʼ ge lɔg metóon téme wégè ézẅé, mélàʼmie pɔ́ ée na yɔ́b twó ńne ńzsé ngie Jÿâŋ laa ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé.»
en: But if we say, ‘Of human origin,’ all the people   will stone us, because they are convinced that John was a prophet.”  # 20:6 Mt 11:9; Lk 7:29–30

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kwaŋ púʼu, ńcʉ́ʼ ńtsɔ́ʼ pɔ́ ngie: «Peg kaa zsé.»
en: So they answered that they did not know its origin.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n te shwóŋo gẅí nyìŋ gẅie n dɔgɔ lezíŋ sé ńgÿo mɔɔn menò wɔ́.»
en: And Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, ńzye lélɔg sagánò ńgɔɔn né láʼ ngie: «Atsɔ̌ ndÿò lǎʼ ńgẅiin nkáʼ wé, ḿbye metÿǒ melùʼ wó, ńcʉ́me mbwó panyɛte melùʼ, ńdu ssé ńgee legìŋ, ńge tóo wó, é néŋe tɛʼ.
en: Now   he began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard,   # 20:9 Is 5:1–7 leased it to tenant farmers, and went away for a long time.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼʉ lékáb ntɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ gÿo ńkuʼ, á túmo tsɔ̌ nyìŋ na ngàŋafàʼ yé, á mbwó pʉ̀a pie ée nkáʼa metÿǒ melùʼ, ngie à gʉa ńkẅé mé mentɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ ńdɔg ńtó. Pɔ́ kúu wó, ńgwoon yé ńcúɔ, ńjwoŋo yé, á piŋ mbwó mesẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: At harvest time he sent a servant to the farmers so that they might give him some fruit from the vineyard. But the farmers beat him and sent him away empty-handed.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńtúmo wetsɔ̌, pɔ́ gíŋe wéwɛ̌ ńcúɔ, ńzoonte yé, ńjwoŋo yé, á piŋ mbwó mesẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: He sent yet another servant, but they beat that one too, treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty-handed.

ngiemboon: Angàŋ nkáʼ gíŋ ńtúmo mbɔ́ɔntè yétá, pɔ́ gíŋ ńnéŋ mefʉ̌ŋ na wéwɛ̌, ńjwoŋo yé.
en: And he sent yet a third, but they wounded this one too and threw him out.

ngiemboon: Angàŋ nkáʼa metÿǒ melùʼ leen ńké ńkwaŋte ngie: “N gÿo lêkɔ́ péʼe?” Ńnéŋe tà ńgɔɔn ngie: “N ge túmo míŋ wɔ̀ɔn gẅie n kwoŋo yé tɛʼ. Pɔ́ ge gǎa wɔ́ɔ, é gÿo mekùʼ mé.”
en: “Then the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What should I do? I will send my beloved    son. Perhaps   # 20:13 Other mss add when they see him they will respect him.’

ngiemboon: Múɔ gʉa ńkúu wó, panyɛte melùʼ gyá yé, ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: “Anjÿòndá wɛ̂ gẅie à tóo lɛ, pege zẅé yé, ńjÿó nkáʼ.”
en: “But when the tenant farmers saw him, they discussed it among themselves and said, ‘This is the heir. Let’s kill him, so that the inheritance will be ours.’

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, éshwoŋo yé ńdɔg fó nkáʼa metÿǒ melùʼ ńkẅɛ, ńzẅé yé.»
en: So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.

ngiemboon: À ge tó gÿo mé zẅéte pɔɔn panyɛte melùʼ, à cʉ́me nkáʼ metÿǒ melùʼ mbwó pe mendyɛ̀ʼɛ.» Aláʼ júʼ páʼ Yěsô cʉmé yɔɔn nò púʼu, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ngǎŋ ngwɔ́ á le gwɔ́ púʼu wɔ́!»
en: He will come and kill    those farmers and give the vineyard to others.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńdíe wɔ́b tà ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tà wɔɔn nkàŋ ŋwàʼne gẅie ée tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ée páʼɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́: “Tóon gẅie papwóon ndá la gwáʼ, à leen ńcʉ́ʼʉ tóon gẅie yé zɔ piʼ ndá?”»
en: But he looked at them and said, “Then what is the meaning of this Scripture:   ,# 20:17 Lk 4:17; 18:31; 21:22,37; 24:44

ngiemboon: Tóon ŋwɛ́ aa gẅie mbɔɔ wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ lɔɔn ńgwe mǒ, mbà ngàŋ ge pwɔʼte. Á piŋ ńgwe na nyìŋ, mbà à ge pú gwɔʼɔ ngàŋ.
en: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces, but on whomever it falls, it will shatter him.”

ngiemboon: Páʼ metándá panuŋepwɔʼ lâ pakyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê, la júʼ yɔɔn sagánò, ńdiŋ ngie à gɔɔn pɔ́ né pɔ́b la, pɔ́ faʼ shÿó légwoon yé, tá ḿbɔ́g nÿɔ́g láʼ.
en: Then the scribes and the chief priests   looked for a way to get their hands on him  # 20:19 Lk 19:47; 21:12 that very hour, because they knew he had told this parable against them, but they feared the people.  # 20:19 Lk 22:2

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńzye légwá ḿbáte yé, ńtúm ngàŋa náŋ nzèm yé, tà pɔ́ gwɔ́ yɔ́b nzèm yé pɔ́ páʼ pʉ̀a membòŋo, tá ne ńzẅíʼte páʼ nò ge kẅɛ pɔ́ ncwò yé, tá mé lɔg ńgwoon yé, ńnáa mbwó ngúmnɔ̀ɔn pà Loma.
en: They   watched closely  # 20:20 Lk 6:7; 14:1 and sent spies  # 20:20 Mt 22:15–16 who pretended to be righteous,  # 20:20 Or upright so that they could catch him in what he said,  # 20:20 Lk 11:54 to hand him  # 20:20 Lk 24:20; Ac 3:13; Rm 8:32 over to the governor’s  # 20:20 Mt 27:2; Lk 21:12 rule and authority.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tó ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: «Tsítsà, peg ne ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ gɔɔn nò, ḿbiŋ ńdaʼte pɔ́ nò gie á tyé ndʉŋndʉŋ, ɔ̀ te líe pʉ̀a pɔ́ na shÿó wɔ́, ńdaʼte nò nénʉ́, pɔ́ páʼ Ssé ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo púʼu.
en: They questioned him, “Teacher, we know that you speak and teach correctly,   and you don’t show partiality  # 20:21 Lit you don’t receive a face,# 20:21 Dt 1:17; 10:17; Mal 2:9; Mt 22:16 but teach truthfully the way of God.  # 20:21 Ac 13:10; 18:25–26

ngiemboon: Shwóŋo wég: Lepʉ̌ ségè ée péʼe ńzẅíŋ ngie pege máʼ ncùb Kásà pà Loma kà ngǎŋ?»
en: Is it lawful   for us to pay taxes  # 20:22 Mt 17:25; Lk 23:2; Rm 13:6–7 to Caesar  # 20:22 Lk 2:1; 3:1; 20:24–25; 23:2 or not? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé ngie pɔ́ zẅíʼi pɔ́ ncwò wé, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: But detecting their craftiness, he said to them,

ngiemboon: «Pi nyɛɛ wɔ́ɔn pàga nkáb. Wɔɔn ée shÿó wɔ̌ gẅie ée na nkáb? Sɔɔn é gwɔ́ lezíŋ wɔ́ sie ée mǒ?» Pɔ́ tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Ée we Kásà, lezíŋ gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ sé.»
en: “Show me a denarius.    Whose image and inscription does it have? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ púʼu, pi náa mmó gie áa ye Kásà mbwó Kásà, ńnáa ye Ssé mbwó Ssé.»
en: “Well then,” he told them, “give to Caesar    the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ júʼ páʼ à tsɔ̌ʼ púʼu, á kʉʼʉ wɔ́b, pɔ́ té gyá tsɔ́ lɔ̌ʼ na shwóŋè gie à gɔ̌ɔn mbwó láʼ wɔ́, ńdáŋte.
en: They were not able to catch him in what he said in public, and being amazed at his answer, they became silent.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ntáʼ pʉ̀a na nùɔ pà Sandúkaye leen ńké ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, pà Sandúkaye ée pʉ̀a pie é té zẅíŋ ngie mepfó ge gÿo zíme na legwé wɔ́.
en: Some   of the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection,  # 20:27 Ac 23:6 came up and questioned him:

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tsítsà, Mǒonsê la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ lepʉ̌ ségè ngie: “Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzɔ́ʼɔ manzwě, ńkwé té cʉa mmó, mbà fɛ̌ we gẅiin lésɔgɔ mpfɔ̌g, pɔ́ yé zyé penkʉ́, ńdɔg ńnuŋe ngẅɛ̀ fɛ̌ we ŋwɛ́.”
en: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother has a wife, and dies childless, his brother should take the wife and produce offspring for his brother.   ,# 20:28 Dt 25:5

ngiemboon: Shwóŋo wég: Etsɔ́ mefɛ̌ laa wó, ńgwɔ́ mbàŋa sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ndùŋmvfò zɔ́ʼ, ńgÿo ńkwé té cʉa mmó.
en: Now there were seven brothers. The first took a wife and died without children.

ngiemboon: Mbɔ́ɔntè sɔgɔ mpfɔ̌g, ńgíŋ ńkwé yé té cʉa mmó.
en: Also the second

ngiemboon: Mbɔ́ɔntè yétá gíŋ sɔgɔ mpfɔ̌g wa, ńkwé pɔ́ te cʉa mmó. Pɔ́ púʼu, tà pɔ́ sɔɔnmbʉ́a pú ńzɔ́ʼɔ wɛ̌ manzwě, ńké ńkwé pɔ́ te cʉa mmó.
en: and the third took her. In the same way, all seven died and left no children.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa zsote, manzwě kwé yé.
en: Finally, the woman died too.

ngiemboon: Páʼ à la pú ńgwɔ́ nzwě pʉ̌a pɔɔn sɔɔnmbʉ́a la, mé ge láʼ zíme na legwé, à gwɔ́ we wɔ̌ fʉʼó?»
en: In the resurrection, therefore, whose wife will the woman be? For all seven had married her.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Áa na fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, mbàŋa lâ panzwě ne ńzɔ́ʼɔ.
en: Jesus told them, “The children of this age    marry and are given in marriage.   # 20:34 Lk 17:27

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa na pʉ̀a pie Ssé gyǎ ngie à ge zíme wɔ́b, pɔ́ kú yɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ sẅé, mbà tsɔ̌ lézɔ́ʼ à te gíŋ ńgwɔ́ wó mbwó yɛ̌ mbàŋa pâ pɛ̌ panzwě wɔ́.
en: But those who are counted worthy    to take part in that age   # 20:35 Mk 10:30 and in the resurrection from the dead neither marry nor are given in marriage.

ngiemboon: Ńzɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, pɔ́ té gíŋe ńgee ńkwé wɔ́. Mélàʼmie pɔ́ cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé la, ńcʉ́ʼ púɔ Ssé, ńtí nue Ssé kẅé wɔ́b mbwó legwé.
en: For they can no longer die,    because they are like angels and are children of God,   # 20:36 Ps 82:6; Mt 5:45; Rm 8:14,19; Gl 3:26 since they are children of the resurrection.

ngiemboon: Kwàʼ Mǒonsê la shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńdaʼte ngie epʉ̀a ge láʼ zíme na legwé. Áa na jʉʼʉ ŋwàʼne gie à la ŋweʼe na nò tsẅɛʼɛ́ legǐ menzóŋ gie à la gyá mmɔ̌g mǒ, á tóŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lê “e Ssé Ábalaham, ńgwɔ́ Ssé Ésàg, ńgwɔ́ Ssé Yakwɔ̂b,”
en: Moses even indicated in the passage about the burning bush that the dead are raised, where he calls the Lord the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.   ,# 20:37 Ex 3:6,15–16; 4:5; Mt 1:2; Ac 3:13; 7:30–32

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ ńgɔɔn ngie, e Ssé te Ssé mepfó pʉ̀a wɔ́, e Ssé, ee Ssé pʉ̀a pie ée ntʉ̀ntʉ̀. Pi zsé ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ntsèm cʉa nzèm Ssé, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie ée ntʉ̀ntʉ̀.»
en: He is not the God of the dead but of the living, because all are living to    him.”   # 20:38 Rm 6:10–11; 14:7–8; 2Co 5:14–15; Gl 2:19–20; 1Th 4:14; 5:10

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼ púʼu, etsɔ́ pakyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê tóonte ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tsítsà ɔ̀ tsɔ̌ʼ kwàʼ mboŋó.»
en: Some of the scribes answered, “Teacher, you have spoken well.”

ngiemboon: Á fó fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, nyìŋ te gíŋ ńgẅiin shÿɔ̀g le gíŋ ńzɛ́te yé tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: And they no longer dared to ask him anything.

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi kwáŋ gí ngie mé zíʼi pʉ̀a ngie Nzàʼnkÿo gẅie Ssé la kaʼ à ge láʼ gwɔ́ nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀ fùɔ Ndavîd péʼe á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ lêkɔ́?
en: Then   he said to them, “How can they say that the Messiah is the son of David?   # 20:41 Mt 1:1,17; Lk 1:27; Rm 1:3; Eph 5:2

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Ndavîd yé máŋwɛ́ gɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne mezɔ̀bɔ ntse ngie:
en: For David himself says in the Book of Psalms:

ngiemboon: ńzẅíʼte tà n dɔg megàŋmbù pú, ńgÿo ntÿɔgɔ́ mekwò mú.”
en: until I make your enemies your footstool.’    ,# 20:42–43 Ps 110:1; Ac 2:34–35; 1Co 15:25; Heb 1:13; 10:13

ngiemboon: Tà fùɔ Ndavîd tóŋo yé lê we “Ndè” páʼɔɔn, Nzàʼnkÿo piŋ ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀ ye lêkɔ́?»
en: David calls him ‘Lord.’ How, then, can he be his son? ”

ngiemboon: Aláʼ ntsèm gie á laa jʉʼó la ne ńzẅíʼte nò gie Yěsô la ne ńgɔɔn, á leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó megàŋakwò pé ngie:
en: While   all the people were listening, he said to his disciples,

ngiemboon: «Pi lÿɔ́ʼ pakyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê páʼɔɔn tɛʼ. Pɔ́ kwoŋo lémaʼ meshʉ̀shʉ̀a menzsǒ, ńdɔg ńgwá ńkʉ́ʼʉ, ńkwoŋ ngie mé tó ńtsyɛʼte wɔ́b ndùmo gyɛ̌, ḿbiŋ ńkúu jʉʼʉ melínɔ̀ɔn, ńkwoŋo lénéŋe pɔ́ na jʉʼʉ melÿò, ńkú mendá cúʼtè, ńkaŋa yɔ́b jʉʼ pɔ́ mvfò.
en: “Beware    of the scribes, who want to go around in long robes and who love greetings in the marketplaces, the best seats in the synagogues, and the places of honor at banquets.   # 20:46 Lk 11:43

ngiemboon: Ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ legye ńkẅé shúm mepfɔ̌g, ńcʉ́ʼʉ létsyɛʼte Ssé, ńdɔgɔ légɔɔn nò á sag sag, ḿbab menÿɔ́g pʉ̀a. E Ssé ge láʼ záb yɔb ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ e tʉ tɛʼ.»
en: They devour widows’ houses and say long prayers just for show. These will receive harsher judgment.”
